contentrichtext.text: {{no footnotes|date=March 2013}} {{Infobox anthem |title = لله فليهاراكن سلطن |transcription = Allah Peliharakan Sultan |english_title = Allah Bless the Sultan |image = Coat of arms of Brunei.svg |image_size = |prefix = National |country = {{BRN}} |author = Pengiran Haji Mohamed Yusuf bin Pengiran Abdul Rahim |lyrics_date = 1947 |composer = Haji Awang Besar bin Sagap |music_date = 1947 |adopted = 1 January 1984 |sound = Untied States Navy Band - Allah Peliharakan Sultan.ogg |sound_title = Allah Peliharakan Sultan }} '''Allah Peliharakan Sultan''' ([[Jawi (script)|Jawi]]:<big> الله فليهاراكن سلطن </big>) ({{lang-en|God Bless the Sultan}}) is the [[national anthem]] of [[Brunei]] Darussalam. The anthem is sung in Malay, the national language of the country. It was written by Pengiran Haji Mohamed Yusuf bin Pengiran Abdul Rahim (later bestowed with the title Yang Amat Mulia Pengiran Setia Negara Pengiran Haji Mohamed Yusuf bin Pengiran Abdul Rahim) and composed by Haji Awang Besar bin Sagap in 1947. It was adopted in 1951 as the national anthem of the [[Protectorate|British protectorate]] of Brunei. It was adapted as the national anthem of Brunei Darussalam upon independence from the [[United Kingdom]], and was sung as the national anthem of the independent state at the stroke of midnight 1 January 1984. ==Usage== The national anthem is sung by schoolchildren in Brunei at the beginning of school during the raising of the [[Flag of Brunei|national flag]] and [[Crest of Brunei|national emblem]] on school assemblies. The national anthem is played each morning early breakfast on [[radio]] and [[television]] by [[Radio Television Brunei|Radio Televisyen Brunei]] (RTB) and at the [[sign-on]] and [[sign-off]] (replay rerun recorded sign-on) of its transmission for the day. ==Lyrics== {| cellpadding=6 ![[Arabic alphabet]] ![[Malay alphabet|Malay alphabet/Rumi]] !English translation |- style="vertical-align:top; white-space:nowrap;" | style="direction:rtl;" | يا الله لنجوتكنله اوسيا <br> كباوه دولي يڠ مها مليا<br> عاديل بردولت منأوڠي نوسا <br> مميمڤين رعية ککل بهاڬيا <br> هيدوڤ سنتوسا نڬارا دان سلطان <br> الهي سلامتكن بروني دارالسلام | Ya Allah lanjutkanlah Usia <br> Kebawah Duli Yang Maha Mulia<br> Adil berdaulat menaungi nusa<br> Memimpin rakyat kekal bahagia<br> Hidup sentosa Negara dan Sultan<br> Ilahi selamatkan Brunei Darussalam | Oh [[God]] Bless [[His Majesty]],<br> With A Long Life<br> Justly And Nobly Rule The Kingdom<br> And Lead Our People Happily Forever<br> Peacefully Be, The Kingdom and Sultan<br> Almighty God, save Brunei, The House of Peace |} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://nationalanthems.me/brunei-allah-peliharakan-sultan/ Audio of ''Allah Peliharakan Sultan'', national anthem of Brunei, with information and lyrics] {{National Anthems of Asia}} [[Category:National anthems]] [[Category:Bruneian music]] [[Category:National symbols of Brunei]]
